html: watch in the watchtower, eat, drink: arise, ye princes, and anoint the shield. Babylon's leaders and revelers feast and celebrate while the watchman looks for invaders. Trusting in their own man-made security and defense (watchtower), the people of Babylon (the worldly) prepare a banquet ("prepare the table") and then eat and drink, unaware of their imminent destruction. The phrase anoint the shield speaks of warriors who prepare for war, because shields were oiled to make them slick so that arrows would be diverted.
